gurmukhi: pwgVdI pHsq piTXo dwgVdI dYkY dl Angn ]kwgVdI kMp BUA auTI bwgVdI bwjIX KurIAn qn ]
transliteration: Paagaddiprahast Pathiyo Daagaddidai-kai Dal Anad|| Kaagaddikanp Bhooa Outhibaagaddibaajiya Khureean Tan||
translation: Then Ravana sent innumerable soldiers with Prahasta for waging the war and the earth trembled under the impact of horses hoofs.

gurmukhi: nwgVdI nIl iqh iJxXo BwgVdI gih BUim pCwVIA ]swgVdI smr hhkwr dwgVdI dwnv dl BwrIA ]
transliteration: Naagaddineel Tih Jhinyo Bhaagaddigad(i) Bhoom(i) Pachhaadeea|| Saagaddisamara Hakhaar Daagaddidaanav Dal Bhdareea||
translation: Neel entangled himself with him and threw him on the ground and there was great lamentation in the demon forces.

gurmukhi: GMGwgVdI Gwie BkBk krq rwgVdI ruihr rx rMg bih ]jMjwgVdI juXh ju`gx jpY kwgVdI kwk kr krkkh ]394]
transliteration: Ghanhaagaddighaae Bhak-bhak Karat Raagaddiraagaddiruhir Ran Ran Bah(i)|| Janjaagaddijuyah Judgad Japai Kaagaddikaak Kar Karak-kah||394||
translation: The wounds were inflicted from which the blood oozed out and flowed. The gatherings of Yoginis began to recite (their mantras) and the cawing of the crows was heard.394.

gurmukhi: pwgVdI pHsq juJMq lwgVdI lY clXo A`p dl ]BwgVdI BUim BVhVI kwgVdI kMpI doeI jl Ql ]
transliteration: Paagaddiprahast Jujhant Laagaddilai Chadyo App Dal|| Bhaagaddibhoom(i) Bhad-hadikaagaddikanpidoijal Thal||
translation: Fighting very bravely alongwith his forces, Prahasta advance forward and with his movement the earth and the water felt a sensation;

gurmukhi: nwgVdI nwd in`h n`d BwgVdI rx Byr BXMkr ]swgVdI swNg Jlhlq cwgVdI cmkMq clq sr ]
transliteration: Naagaddinaad Nihh Nadd Bhaagaddiran Bher Bhayankar|| Saagaddisaan Jhal-halat Chaagaddichamkant Chalat Sar||
translation: There was dreadful sound and the dreadful resonance of drums was heard; the lances glittered and the shining arrows were discharged;

gurmukhi: KMKwgVdI Kyiq KVg iKmkq Khq cwgVdI ctk icngyN kFY ]TMTwgVdI Twt T`t kr mno TwgVdI Txk TiTAr gFY ]395]
transliteration: Khankhadganndikhet(i) Khadag Khimkat Khahat Chaagaddichatak Chingen Kadhai|| Thanthaagaddithaat Thatt Kar Mano Thaagaddithanak Thathiar Gadhai||395||
translation: There was rattling of spears and with their blows on the shields the sparks arose; such a knocking sound was heard the sparks arose; such a knocking sound was heard as though a tinker was fashioning a utensil.395.

gurmukhi: FwgVdI Fwl auClih bwgVdI rx bIr bb`kih ]AwgVdI iek lY clYN iek khu iek auc`kih ]
transliteration: Dhaagaddidhaal Ouchlah(i) Baagaddiran Beer Babakkah(i)|| Aagaddiik Lai Chalain Ik Kauh Ik Ouchakkah(i)||
translation: The shields sprang up and the warriors began to shout at each other with one tone; the weapons were struck and they rose high and then fell down.

gurmukhi: qwgVdI qwl qMburM bwgVdI rx bIn su b`jY ]swgVdI sMK ky sbd gwgVdI gYvr gl g`jY ]
transliteration: Taagadditaal Tanbooran Baagaddiran Been Su Bajjai|| Saagaddisankh Ke Sabad Gadgadddigadvar Gad Gadjai||
translation: It appeared that the stringed musical instruments and lyers were played in one tune; the sound of the conches thundered all around;

gurmukhi: DMDwgVdI Drix DV Duik prq cwgVdI ckq icq mih Amr ]pMpwgVdI puhp brKw krq jwgVdI j`C gMDRb br ]396]
transliteration: Dhandhaagaddidharan(i) Dhad Dhouk(i) Parat Chaagaddichakat Chit Maih Amar|| Panpaagaddipuhap Barkhaa Karat Jaagaddijachchh Gaddhrab Bar||396||
translation: The heart of he beat and seeing the dreadfulness of war the gods also wondered and the Yakshas, Gandharvas etc. began to shower flowers.396.

gurmukhi: JwgVdI Ju`J Bt igrYN mwgVdI muK mwr aucwrY ]swgVdI sMj pMjry GwGVdI GxIAr jxu kwrY ]
transliteration: Jhaagaddijhujjh Bhat Girain Maagaddimoukh Maar Oucdareeai|| Saagaddisanj Pandare Ghaaghaddighaneear Jan(u) Kdarai||
translation: The warriors even falling down began to shout “Kill, Kill” from their mouths; wearing their gauzy armours they appeared like the waving dark clouds;

gurmukhi: qwgVdI qIr brKMq gwgVdI gih gdw girstM ]mwgVdI mMqR muK jpY AwgVdI A`Cr br iestM ]
transliteration: Taagadditeer Barkhanndgadgaddigad(i) Gadaa Gadistan|| Maagaddimantra Moukh Japai Aagaddiachchhar Bar Istan||
translation: There was shower of maces and arrows and the heavenly damsels began to recite mantras in order to wed their dear warriors.

gurmukhi: sMswgVdI sdw isv ismr kr jwgVdI jUJ joDw mrq ]sMswgVdI suBt snmuK igrq AwgVdI Ap`Crn kh brq 397 ]
transliteration: Sansaagaddisadaa Siv Simar Kar Jaagaddijoojh Jodhaa Marat|| Sansaagaddisoubhat Sanmoukh Girat Aagaddiapachchhran Kah Barat||397||
translation: The heroes remembered Shiva and died while fighting and on their falling down the heavenly damsels advanced to wed them.397.

gurmukhi: ieqY au`cry rwm lMkys bYxM ]auqY dyv dyKY cVY rQ gYxM ]
transliteration: Itai Ouchchre Raam Lankes Bainan|| Outai Dev Dekhai Chadai Rath Gadnan||
translation: On this side there is dialogue between Ram and Ravana and on the other side the gods mounted on their chariots in the sky are looking at this scene.
